text:
The last 3 years have strained the
nursing workforce in new ways.

Burnout has reached an all-time high.
Hospital floors are short-staffed,

and the administrative burden facing
nurses is greater than ever before.

For all of these reasons nurses
are leaving hospitals in droves.

Last year the US saw an unprecedented
turnover rate of 28 percent among nurses.

And without enough nurses, health
systems simply do not work.

That means that floors close.
Wait times for patients skyrocket.

And nurses have to work in areas
that we're not well trained in.

And all of this causes the quality
of patient care to suffer.

As a registered nurse myself,
I know that we nurses seek

flexibility, predictability, and
autonomy in our roles.

But hospitals today lack the data
and operational agility

to meet the needs
of the modern nurse.

And that's why we've built
M7 Health,

a nursing workforce management
platform for health systems.

Our first contribution
towards this mission
is the M7 Smart Scheduler.

Schedules are the backbone
of the nursing experience.

It's the most important driver
of work life balance.

Our product digitizes
the scheduling process,

allowing nurses to better
be matched with shifts

that meet their personal
and professional needs.

And when this is done right,
everybody wins.
Nurses get unprecedented flexibility.

Managers get time back to
reinvest in their units.

And hospital leadership
gets to know their nurses
like never before.

Nurses go into the profession
to care for patients.

So join us on our mission
to help nurses

get back to doing what
they love and to making

health systems a sustainable
place to provide care.
